translation.en: -[Tyler] How's it going? -[man] Oh!
-I'm Tyler. -[man] What's up, Tyler?
[Tyler] Nice to meet you.
-Curious to see what comes through. -Let's do it.
Gonna center myself, take deep breaths.
-[man] Do your thing. -And then we will see what comes in.
translation.ko: 편하게 하세요 그런 다음 뭐가 떠오르는지 보죠

translation.en: [Tyler sighs] Okay.
We're gonna talk about living people.
translation.ko: 살아 계신 분 얘길 좀 할게요

translation.en: -Okay. -[Tyler] Um…
There's gonna be something that comes up
pertaining to someone having a difficulty breathing,
translation.ko: 숨을 제대로 못 쉬는 분이 있어요

translation.en: either finding a spot on an X-ray of our lungs.
There's something coming in,
but it doesn't feel like it's been taken as seriously as it should.
My mother.
[Tyler] So, if Mom has had some breathin' stuff?
She said she had a spot on her lung.
-But that's-- -Yeah.
How did you know that? Like, would it… You felt the spot? Or like…
[Tyler] I see it visually. I had a collapsed lung,
translation.ko: 눈에 보여요 저도 폐허탈을 앓긴 했지만

translation.en: but it comes through similar in the sense of
literally seeing an X-ray and seeing a spot.
[chuckles] That's just… My mind, man.
[Tyler] So we're gonna keep going. Just switching gears a bit.
It's coming in on the cousin level.
Oh! Just give me one second.
[man] Yeah. It hit you, man, if you know what I know.
translation.ko: 내가 짐작하는 그거라면 그 사건 같은데요

translation.en: Yes, all good. My chest is killing me here,
translation.ko: 네, 괜찮아요 가슴 통증이 너무 심하네요

translation.en: but give me one second.
There's a kind of a feeling I'm getting shot from the side.
Hey, yo.
You're absolutely right.
I mean, there's no way you would know that.
translation.ko: 당신이 그걸 미리 알 방법이 없어요

translation.en: [Tyler] I always used drawing and painting as a way to relax or meditate.
translation.ko: 저는 늘 그림을 그리며 긴장을 풀거나 명상을 했어요

translation.en: But I never thought the scribbling I do in high school,
not paying attention to the teacher,
would end up being part of my career.
I would sit and scribble, and scribble, and scribble.
One day, I was doodling and started feeling things.
translation.ko: 그러던 어느 날 뭔가를 느끼기 시작했어요

translation.en: So I started implementing them more into readings.
When I'm connecting, I really liken myself to that of a canvas.
translation.ko: 저는 교감할 때 자신을 캔버스에 비유해요

translation.en: And the person that comes through paints the picture.
But in the beginning, it was really difficult to regulate my ability.
translation.ko: 처음엔 제 능력을 조절하기가 쉽지 않았어요

translation.en: I couldn't really turn it up in the sense of increasing it or even really decrease it.
Who's that?
When I was ten years old, I was lying in bed. I remember being woken up.
translation.ko: 10살 때 잠에서 깨 침대에 누워 있는데

translation.en: When I opened my eyes, I just had this knowingness
translation.ko: 눈을 뜨는 순간 할머니가 돌아가실 거라는 걸

translation.en: that my grandmother was going to die.
As I was explaining this feeling to my mom, the phone rang.
My dad was on the other end.
He gave her the news that my grandmother had just taken her final breath.
It was only years later that I understood that to be a premonition.
translation.ko: 그게 예감이란 걸 몇 년이 지나서야 알았어요

translation.en: It took years of practice and relaying the information I would get
translation.ko: 훈련을 통해 정보를 전달하고 통제할 수 있을 때까지

translation.en: to start to get a semblance of control.
From the ages of 16 to 18, I was doing readings almost every day.
Word of mouth spread very quickly.
Before I knew it, I had people coming to my front door and leaving notes.
translation.ko: 어느새 사람들이 찾아와 문 앞에 메모를 남기고 갔어요

translation.en: And from there, I started getting requests from Southern California.
translation.ko: 그러다가 남부 캘리포니아에서 요청이 들어오기 시작했죠

translation.en: With his uncanny ability to connect to those who've passed,
twenty-year-old Tyler Henry blows celebrities' minds off and on camera
translation.ko: 20살의 타일러 헨리는 E!의 히트작 '할리우드 영매 타일러 헨리'에서

translation.en: in his hit E! series Hollywood Medium With Tyler Henry.
My life took a very weird turn.
[reporter] The most sought-after clairvoyant around.
-You are the real thing. -Thank you.
[Tyler] When I was nineteen, I began filming a television show.
Oh my gosh.
And from there, I started doing live shows.
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, Tyler Henry!
[Tyler] These are in front of an audience of up to 3,000 people.
Hello, everybody!
[Tyler] This journey really did make me come full circle
translation.ko: 이 여정을 통해 제가 왜 이 일을 시작했는지

translation.en: as to why I started in the first place.
Filming this show has lent me an opportunity to help people
translation.ko: 이 쇼는 리딩이 꼭 필요한 사람들을

translation.en: who have a deep need for reading.
When I took the leap and had the courage to share my ability,
translation.ko: 리딩으로 가장 큰 혜택을 받을 사람들을 위해

translation.en: I was doing it for people who I thought could benefit from it the most.
translation.ko: 용기를 내서 제 능력을 공유한 거예요

translation.en: To see how my life has evolved now, being back in that place
translation.ko: 출발점으로 돌아와 제 삶이 발전한 것을 보며

translation.en: has, I think, been a reminder of why I do what I do.
translation.ko: 왜 이 일을 하는지 다시금 깨달았어요

translation.en: Has anything been coming through for this reading?
translation.ko: 이번 리딩과 관련해 뭐 좀 떠올랐어요?

translation.en: There's a lot of feminine energy, so…
-From who you're going to read? -Yeah. Yeah.
My assistant Heather is a big part of my life.
translation.ko: 비서인 헤더는 제 인생의 큰 부분을 차지해요

translation.en: She's instrumental in getting me from point A to point B
translation.ko: 제가 A에서 B 지점으로 갈 때 중요한 역할을 하죠

translation.en: because I never know what I'm going into.
The producers don't tell me anything, where I'm going,
translation.ko: 제작진이 아무 말도 안 해줘요 어디로 가는지

translation.en: who I'm reading, what's going on.
All Heather and my mom know is where to drop me off.
translation.ko: 헤더랑 엄마는 저를 데려다줘야 할 곳만 알죠

translation.en: That's literally it.
There's a bit much feeling of
a death and a birth.
Within kind of a short period of one another.
It's a weird sensation. It's kind of that vibe of like,
"I die, you live," kind of thing.
-I dunno. It's weird. -Mm-hmm.
-Hi! How's it going? -[woman] Hello.
-Welcome to my home. -[Tyler] It's lovely to meet you.
I'm having palpitations because I didn't think this day would come.
translation.ko: 심장이 두근대요 이런 날이 올 줄 몰랐거든요

translation.en: -[Tyler] Hello, everybody! -Hi!
[Tyler] How's it going?
-My beautiful girlfriends. -Oh, hi! How are you?
-Good to meet you. How are you? -[friend 1] Hi. Nice to meet you.
-Very. -[Tyler] Good to see you all.
How's it going?
-Good. Thank you so much for coming. -Absolutely.
-And for hanging out. -[Tyler] This is where it's at.
[friend 2] We're so excited to have you.
I wouldn't have missed it.
You don't know how many times we've sat here,
drank wine, and just dreamt of this moment.
I'm excited. I already have stuff coming, but I'll explain my process.
translation.ko: 저도 신나요 벌써 뭔가 떠오르는데 과정을 설명해 드릴게요

translation.en: -Let you know what to expect. -Oh my God, that gave me…
translation.ko: - 무슨 일이 생길지 알려드리죠 - 세상에, 나 벌써…

translation.en: [Tyler] There's a lot of stuff with this,
so it's important for me to get into a certain headspace.
translation.ko: 의식 속 특정 공간에 들어가는 건데

translation.en: But I'm excited to see what comes through, and we'll go from there.
translation.ko: 뭐가 떠오르는지 보고 거기에 따라 결정하죠

translation.en: -All right? -Sounds good.
I have my notepad here, as you're familiar with.
-[friend 3] I feel my heart jolting. -Mine too. I need a drink of wine.
translation.ko: 벌써 심장이 쿵쾅거려 - 나도, 와인 좀 마셔야겠어 - 나도

translation.en: That's all right. [friend 3] I don't think my heart's not in my…
Good. Okay. There, there.
I had a lot of feminine energy coming through on the way here.
translation.ko: 여기 오는 길에 여성 에너지를 많이 느꼈어요

translation.en: Granted, female here, but this person's excited to come through.
translation.ko: 의뢰인이 여성이니 당연한 거지만 이분은 지금 신나 있어요

translation.en: When I get this tier of excitement,
it usually indicates somebody who passed away early,
who wasn't able to hit middle age, is the way that I would describe this.
translation.ko: 중년이 되기 전에 세상을 떠났을 거예요

translation.en: And when I'm connecting with this person, I suspect this is a female.
Without giving it away, can you relate to a female who passed prematurely?
-Yes. Oh yes. -Okay. Gotcha.
There's a lot of specifics, so I have to connect more deeply.
translation.ko: 세부 사항이 많아서 더 깊이 연결해야겠어요

translation.en: All right.
So she does bring up this emphasis on a symbol of hummingbirds.
Any time I see hummingbirds, it almost always indicates
that somebody has had an experience, and it may only be one person,
translation.ko: 한 사람만 그랬을 수도 있지만 벌새와 관련해서

translation.en: that feels sentimental in some way related to
a hummingbird, the way this comes across. It has to be a hummingbird.
translation.ko: 지금 떠오르는 거로 봐서는 반드시 벌새여야 해요

translation.en: If there are other bird-related signs, wings--
Oh, she had a tattoo of a hummingbird!
-[friend 2] Oh my God! Yes, she did! -That's immediately what I thought of.
translation.ko: - 맙소사! 맞아! - 나도 바로 그 생각 했어

translation.en: I love it. I love it so much.
It seems to be a spirit animal thing,
the way this comes across, something she relates to.
That's good to keep in mind. Keep your eyes out for that kind of thing.
-I can tell that it meant something. -Okay.
Give me one sec.
Trying to symbolically figure this out.
Okay, so there would have been a couple things.
She had funny music taste, strange.
All over the place.
[Tyler] I'll tell you, 'cause it's weird.
-Tell us. -Oh my gosh.
Okay. There's a funny thing. If I looked at her, I wouldn't think
that she would like this specific kind of music.
translation.ko: 이런 음악은 안 들을 것 같거든요

translation.en: [friend 1] My God. If he says what I think…
I have no idea how I'm going to--
-[friend 2] Don't tell us. My God. -He wouldn't know.
I feel almost kind of, I don't know what this is.
There's something funny with it, where I feel like
it's not matching when I would look at her
versus what she had going on. But it's--
That makes sense.
-This is what we always talk about. -[Tyler] Weird.
When we're highlighting this person,
she comes through as a spitfire, very independent, which is coming across.
-She's a firecracker, spicy. -[woman] Definitely.
-It's the only way to describe her. -Spice Girls!
translation.ko: - 달리 묘사할 방법이 없어요 - 스파이스 걸스!

translation.en: -Yes -Spice girl.
[Tyler] Okay. Give me one sec.
Okay. Okay.
As a medium, I receive impressions.
I get very small tidbits of details
I have to interpret and make sense of based on my previous readings and experience
I try to set the intention,
as I'm communicating with whoever's coming through, to elaborate
translation.ko: 그 사람이 하려는 말을 전달하려고 노력해요

translation.en: on either how they passed,
what's important to them, the messages that might be meaningful.
translation.ko: 중요한 게 뭐였는지 등 의미 있는 메시지를요

translation.en: When I sit in a reading, I intend to get as much information
from that spirit as I can get.
In the six months before she would've passed,
she's putting this emphasis on trying to get as healthy as she can get.
And I feel like I'm trying to almost monitor my weight to make sure
that I'm at a healthy place.
She would have had this susceptibility to diabetes, that kind of thing.
translation.ko: 당뇨병 같은 것에 걸리기 쉬운 체질이었나 봐요

translation.en: She kind of struck me as that. Does that make sense?
-One hundred percent. -That's crazy.
[Tyler] But there is this aspect she is bringing up.
This feeling of very suddenly realizing that
I feel like I need to go the hospital, or like I need to get medical attention.
She felt like people might have told her, "Oh, it's just nerves. It's normal."
translation.ko: 사람들은 이랬던 것 같대요 '신경이 곤두서서 그래, 정상이야'

translation.en: -Yes. -[Tyler] But she knew something was wrong.
I feel kind of almost like something's filling up.
I don't know really how to describe it, but it feels like something's gone amiss.
translation.ko: 어떻게 설명할지 모르겠는데 뭔가 빠져나가는 것도 같고요

translation.en: -Hundred percent. -Yes, everything you're saying is…
translation.ko: - 정확해요 - 네, 당신이 하는 말 모두…

translation.en: [Tyler] Gotcha. Okay.
Uh, there's this feeling of being more concerned about somebody else than myself.
translation.ko: 본인보다 다른 사람을 더 걱정하는 느낌도 있어요

translation.en: It's 'cause I see my symbol for selflessness.
It's so weird. I was born about three months early, um, as a child,
and weirdly, I feel like a premature birth.
Someone being born premature.
Some relevance there, but she wasn't born…
I don't think it's her who was born premature,
or some other aspect here I'm trying to unravel.
translation.ko: 제가 밝히려는 다른 측면을 봐도 그래요

translation.en: -[Tyler] Was she pregnant? -[all] Yes.
Great. Okay, so there's a lot coming in.
So I feel like I have to bring up,
she acknowledges this feeling of anything done to extend her life,
translation.ko: 삶을 연장하려고 했다면 그게 어떤 방법이든

translation.en: or to try, would've failed by default. She didn't wanna be put on a ventilator.
translation.ko: 실패했을 거라서 산소 호흡기는 원치 않았대요

translation.en: She didn't want anything along those lines that would've kept her alive artificially.
translation.ko: 인공적으로 생명을 유지하는 건 원치 않았대요

translation.en: She acknowledges acceptance around this.
She just seems to be extremely focused on this child
translation.ko: 이 아이에게 완전히 집중했던 것 같아요

translation.en: that I… I feel made it, but that too came very close to… to not happening.
-I suspect. -[woman] Wow.
-[Tyler] Do we know of a situation? -Yes. Oh yes.
As we've covered clearly a little bit about what happened,
if you wanna fill in the blanks for me of who she was to you all?
translation.ko: 빈칸을 채워 줄래요? 여러분께 어떤 사람이었죠?

translation.en: -This is our best friend, Lauren. -[friend 2] Our best friend, Lauren.
[woman 2] Lauren?
[woman 1] She was our crazy white girl.
-I love you, bestie. -Hello.
[friend 2] Lauren was mother hen.
Lauren took care of everything.
She's the one that said, "I'll do it."
-I'll do it. -[friend 3] I'll do it.
She was so loved.
[friend 1] We'd always joke 'cause she was brown on the inside.
She loved Mexican food. She loved mariachi bands.
And she didn't even speak Spanish. She loved that music. [laughs]
When you were like, "This music does not--"
-Doesn't match her. Makes sense. -Doesn't match. She loved Mexican music.
translation.ko: - 안 어울렸어요 - 그랬죠 - 멕시코 음악 팬이었어요 - 말 되네요

translation.en: -It was like mariachi, banda. -We'd be like, "Lauren!"
[Tyler] Was she Italian?
-Yes! -[laughs] Gotcha.
[friend 1] And she loved being Italian.
[friend 2] She said, "We're Italian." She always made sure.
I'm Italian.
I'm Italian. Yes.
[chuckles] There you go.
That's precious. All right.
So, with her situation,
if you don't mind telling me, can I know how she passed?
You mentioned that she knew something was got up.
translation.ko: 뭔가 차오르거나 빠져나가는 것 같은 느낌을

translation.en: -Or missed. -[Tyler] Yes.
I remember she called me when she had a gestational diabetes test,
translation.ko: 임신성 당뇨 검사를 받을 때 제게 전화했는데

translation.en: and she was really worried about that.
-And I said, "Don't worry. Just relax." -Yeah.
When she got her results back, she's like, "I'm a point away from it."
translation.ko: 그러곤 결과가 나왔는데 1점 차로 당뇨가 아니래서

translation.en: I said, "That's really close."
And she's like, "But, you know."
In all honesty, she brought it up in the very beginning,
translation.ko: 솔직히 말하면 처음에 그 얘기를 했어요

translation.en: the conscientious around diabetes--
[woman] I would look at her and be like, "You know, your weight--"
-She had swollen-- -She had everything that showed that.
translation.ko: - 부종이 심해서… - 모든 증상이 그걸 가리켰죠

translation.en: -Fatigue. Everything. -[woman] Fatigue.
It was about a month before her due date.
We actually had a tamale party the Saturday before, we--
translation.ko: 사실 그전 토요일에 타말레 파티를 했는데…

translation.en: We have a traditional tamale party where we get together--
translation.ko: 다 함께 타말레 파티를 하는 전통이 있어요

translation.en: -[woman] In December. -We drink wine, and we make tamales.
-Yeah. -[friend 3] Right before Christmas.
So, we all got together, and, um, she didn't look that well.
translation.ko: 그래서 다 같이 모였는데 안 좋아 보였어요

translation.en: She looked tired.
And we just thought it was just she was, you know, getting more pregnant.
translation.ko: 그래도 임신 말기라서 그런가 보다 했어요

translation.en: [woman] Fast forward, she was admitted for chest pain.
[woman] You mentioned filling up.
-[Tyler] Something filling and emptying. -And emptying out.
-So the hospital pumped her with fluids. -Oh.
[woman] She's like, "I feel like my body's going crazy."
-She felt like she was drowning. -[friend 3] She was messaging us.
translation.ko: - 물에 빠진 기분이랬어요 - 우리한테 문자를 보냈어요

translation.en: -Like, "I'm really scared." -"I'm sick."
translation.ko: - 물에 빠진 기분이랬어요 - 우리한테 문자를 보냈어요 - '너무 무서워' - '아파'

translation.en: "I don't know what's going on. I don't know what this means."
-Her words were pain. -Yikes.
[woman] So I just drove to the hospital,
and then they were keeping her alive to get Baby out in time.
translation.ko: 아기를 꺼낼 때까지 목숨만 부지해둔 상태더군요

translation.en: So Baby was without oxygen.
He was a month early.
-You mentioned preemie. -Yes.
-So it's very spot on. -[Tyler] I see.
And she puts a lot of acceptance, so long as the baby was to live.
-That was important for her. -[woman] He's beautiful.
I'm so glad that he made it.
-It was such a scary close call. -He's beautiful.
We'll talk about where this child is currently.
-'Cause I see him being kept away. -[woman] Yeah.
And that this is an area of frustration.
Do we know of a situation along those lines?
-Yes. -[Tyler] Okay.
With whatever you're comfortable sharing, how did that pertain?
She said she was gonna be the godmother, and, um…
-That wasn't the case. -[woman] It really hurt.
translation.ko: - 그렇게 안 됐어요 - 정말 가슴 아팠어요

translation.en: We see pictures on Facebook and stuff. So that's how we connect.
That won't always be the case.
I wanna emphasize this.
That's going to change.
She wants these people in her life that were important
to be able to have a relationship with this kid,
but it may not be the case now, so just--
-[friend 3] She knows that? -[Tyler] Absolutely.
[friend 3] Good.
That for me is one of the most important messages of this reading.
translation.ko: 그게 이번 리딩에서 가장 중요한 메시지예요

translation.en: -Just that. -That's what we wanted.
That's what we asked for.
Absolutely. I do suspect, um, there's something with this.
translation.ko: 물론이죠 이것과 관련해 뭔가 있는 것 같아요

translation.en: [smacks lips] Okay, there.
There, there, Okay.
She is having me talk about, um, Rich. Rich, Rich, Rich, Rich, Rich. Who's Rich?
-Richie. -[Tyler] It's a name.
-Oh, Richie! -[Tyler] Who's Richie?
[woman] She didn't meet my second child. I was pregnant with him
translation.ko: 로런은 제 둘째를 못 봤어요 출산 전이었거든요

translation.en: when she passed.
That's where we're going. She's having me highlight this little one,
and I feel like she's making a big point to acknowledge him and his birth.
translation.ko: 아이와 아이의 출생을 잘 알고 있대요

translation.en: I'm putting a lot of love around that, and I feel like it's big.
I had a complication after my epidural.
-[Tyler] Right. -And I thought I was gonna die. [chuckles]
But I felt her.
That's the message with this. By bringing him up,
it was validation that she was part of that process.
Yeah. I thought about her the whole time when I was in there.
She knew this, so please know there's no accidents.
translation.ko: 인제 알았으니 우연이 아니었단 걸 알아주세요

translation.en: -She sacrificed for his health. -[Tyler] She was a big part of it.
translation.ko: - 아이를 위해 자길 희생했어 - 로런이 도운 거예요

translation.en: It shows that she was involved on the other side,
and the people that loved her.
-That didn't end just because she passed. -[friend 2] Yeah.
When she comes through, she acknowledges a sense of peace at her passing.
translation.ko: 여러분이 로런의 죽음을 극복한 것 같아 좋대요

translation.en: -Okay. -[Tyler] How she's honored moving forward.
-She seems all good. -[woman] Yeah.
And very proud.
And just so connected to her sisters, is really how it feels more than anything.
translation.ko: 친구들과 교감할 수 있어 무엇보다 행복하대요

translation.en: I can't believe everything you're telling us.
translation.ko: 당신이 말하는 모든 게 믿어지지 않아요

translation.en: Aw, I'm so glad. I know it's pretty cool.
[woman] I thought we'd get two or three things--
-You know-- -You were reading into our journal.
translation.ko: - 정말이지… - 우리 일기를 읽는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: -Yes. -[laughing]
This has been an amazing girls' night.
I feel personally I wanna hang out with you again.
-We really feel like you brought Lauren. -[friend 3] We got our Lauren.
translation.ko: - 덕분에 로런을 찾은 기분이에요 - 로런을 되찾았어

translation.en: Oh, I'm so glad.
Today, it felt like Lauren was sitting there with us.
He said a hundred things to validate that--
-We're gonna walk through this. -She was here.
translation.ko: - 아직도 안 믿겨요 - 로런이 여기 있었어요

translation.en: Yeah. Everything he said was spot on.
[Tyler] Oh my goodness.
[Heather] Yeah?
That was so good. It was a group of four people.
-[Heather] Yeah? -[Tyler] Yeah.
It was their friend who passed, who was a female
who had passed away when she was pregnant.
She died giving birth to her baby.
-So the baby, the baby lived. -That's what you said!
-That's exactly what you said. -[Tyler] Yes, it's nuts.
translation.ko: - 당신이 말한 그대로예요 - 네, 장난 아녜요

translation.en: [Heather gasps] She's… wow. Gosh.
[Tyler] That was so special.
[Heather] Yeah.
[Tyler] It was a lot to digest.
-[Heather] Yeah. -[Tyler] For me and for them.
translation.ko: - 감정적으로 힘들었어요 - 네 - 나도, 그분들도요 - 쉽지 않죠

translation.en: [Heather] It's not easy. It's more the after.
translation.ko: - 나도, 그분들도요 - 쉽지 않죠 사실 지금이 더 힘들어요

translation.en: It's more going home now.
It's where my challenge kind of begins.
-Yeah. -Letting it go, which, you know…
It's like, to get to that headspace,
I have to like sacrifice some of my own existence, weirdly,
translation.ko: 묘한 일이지만 내 존재의 일부를 희생하고

translation.en: and it, like, stays with the people.
And then as days go on, it kind of comes back to me,
but I feel like I left a part of myself there.
translation.ko: 내 일부를 저기 두고 온 느낌이죠

translation.en: It's really weird.
Okay, so, I'm gonna put these in here for you.
Like five. Because you can never have too many toothbrushes.
Okay.
[Theresa] Daddy Wasserman will be proud of ya.
-Oh, don't. -[Theresa] That's our dentist.
No. He's gonna know I call him "Daddy" now.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 내가 '아빠'라고 부르는 걸 인제 알게 됐잖아요

translation.en: Oh! He says "Open wide." I'm like, "Yes, sir."
Tyler.
[Tyler] 'Kay.
-[Theresa] Ay, ay, ay. -Now he's gonna know.
Cat's out of the bag.
It's not my fault I have a hot dentist.
translation.ko: 치과 주치의가 멋있는 게 내 잘못인가?

translation.en: It sounds a little stereotypical, but my mom is my best friend,
translation.ko: 뻔한 얘기 같지만 엄마는 제 절친이에요

translation.en: and we have a straightforward relationship.
My mom gets me. I get her. We're beyond the point of cordiality. Um, yeah.
translation.ko: 서로 이해하는 정말 끈끈한 관계예요, 네

translation.en: I'm kinda tired. [chuckles] I think we're supposed to be packing.
-Oh my God. -Yeah. Oh man.
What's for dinner?
-What's for dinner? -Am I supposed to read your mind? [laughs]
translation.ko: - 오늘 저녁 뭐야? - 엄마 마음 읽어야 해요?

translation.en: My mom is the embodiment of a great mother.
Any good I do, I really believe comes from the strength that she gave me.
translation.ko: 제가 선을 베풀 수 있는 건 엄마가 제게 주신 힘 덕분이에요

translation.en: So, yeah.
[interviewer] Have you ever tried to read your mom?
Yea… Yeah. Yeah.
I spontaneously read my mom when I was a teenager one day.
translation.ko: 십 대일 때 우연히 엄마를 리딩했는데

translation.en: I had a name come through,
and I asked her who it was,
and she just burst into tears crying
because the person I had identified
had done something really bad to my mom.
She's never told me the extent of what that was.
translation.ko: 어느 정도로 나쁜지는 말씀 안 하셨어요

translation.en: So it's a mystery.
I think that was really a turning point to my mom's understanding of my ability,
translation.ko: 그때가 전환점이었어요 처음엔 엄마가 제 능력을 숨겼죠

translation.en: that she had kept secrets to protect me,
and I was still capable of seeing through some things.
I thought that was definitely a turning point.
For sure.
But yeah, it goes to show as a medium,
I can see some pieces of information,
but often not the whole picture.
-[man] Ready? -[Tyler] Yep.
Sorry. I just don't know my own strength.
Clint is my partner of four-and-a-half years.
translation.ko: 파트너인 클린트와는 함께한 지 4년 반 됐어요

translation.en: [interviewer] How did you guys meet?
He would tell you a different story, but he tweeted me.
He slid into those DM's.
Gays, man. They're persistent.
And don't you forget it.
I think coming from a small town in Georgia, I feel like he just,
translation.ko: 조지아주 작은 마을 출신이라서 제 느낌이지만

translation.en: he really wanted somebody to relate to. I had an immediate connection with him.
translation.ko: 공감할 사람이 필요했나 봐요 우린 순식간에 통했죠

translation.en: [Clint] So as far as your mom's family,
I've hit a brick wall there, and nobody wants to talk.
translation.ko: 벽에 부딪혔어 아무도 입을 열지 않아

translation.en: Yeah.
The majority of the research that I was doing back when this all started
translation.ko: 이 일이 처음 시작됐을 때 내가 한 건 대부분

translation.en: was with the family DNA research
-[Tyler] Correct. -We didn't know what we were looking for.
translation.ko: - 맞아 - 그땐 뭘 찾아야 할지 몰랐지

translation.en: At first, you did the DNA test. It came back different than you thought.
translation.ko: 처음에 네가 DNA 검사를 했을 때 결과가 예상 밖이었지

translation.en: But when your mom did it was when, like--
-[Tyler] We really realized. -Shit got weird.
Whoops!
DNA don't lie.
It was only two years ago that my mom found out her mother wasn't her mother.
translation.ko: 2년 전에야 알게 됐어요 할머니도 엄마의 친모가 아니고

translation.en: Her father wasn't her father.
The siblings she had, she wasn't related to,
and we were just stunned. We were in complete shock.
On every level here, there's mystery.
Absolutely. Yeah.
You'd think as a medium, I should be able to call everybody on the other side
and figure out what happened to my mom.
But every step of the way, I've hit a wall.
I'm too biased and connected to the situation to be emotionally objective,
translation.ko: 저는 너무 편향돼 있어 감정적으로 객관적이지 않거든요

translation.en: and because of that, I need help finding the answers we're seeking.
I wanna know how exactly Stella obtained my mom,
translation.ko: 스텔라가 엄마를 얻게 된 경위가 궁금해

translation.en: and what my mom's biological mother thought was happening.
translation.ko: 생모는 그 상황을 어떻게 생각했는지도 알고 싶고

translation.en: Did she know?
Did she think that my mom was going to somebody else?
How did that happen?
I have a right to know, and I'm not gonna let anyone stop me.
translation.ko: 난 알 권리가 있고 아무도 막을 수 없어

translation.en: We just have to figure out who can help.
Yeah. I just wonder why, like…
This is so convoluted.
[Tyler] We should get some of those stickers.
-[Theresa] What stickers? -"Student driver."
-[Theresa] Where? For who? -Right there. See?
You. We'll put them on the back, so people are warned.
translation.ko: 엄마요, 뒤에 붙여요 사람들한테 경고해 줘야죠

translation.en: [Theresa] You're hilarious.
[Theresa] I predict you're going to have an amazing reading today.
I sure hope so.
I did have someone come through earlier who passed away in a fire.
What?
[Tyler] I could tell this was a male. I'd be interested to see who this is.
[Theresa] Come on. Buck up. It's gonna be okay.
[Tyler] Hello. How's it going? Oh!
I'm Tyler.
-What's up? -Nice to meet you.
-Bring it in. COVID or not. -Aw. Lovely to meet you.
-Good to meet you too. -Thank you for having me.
-Absolutely. -This is so cool.
-[man] Welcome to my world. -Amazing.
translation.ko: - 내 세상에 온 걸 환영해요 - 굉장해요

translation.en: -What's your name? -Cals.
-Cals. Nice to meet you. -You look just like…
-Never mind. -[Tyler] Yeah?
-Macaulay Culkin. I get him a lot. -[Cals laughs] I wasn't sure.
-This is a cool place. What's this studio? -[Cals] Yeah.
The name of this studio is Stankonia Studios.
It was named after Outkast's album.
Lot of history has been made in this studio.
[Tyler] I believe it.
-Curious to see what comes through. -Let's do it.
-Do you any have objects? -[Cals] Yeah.
You can whip 'em out now.
[Tyler] Amazing. You can put it right there.
I'm gonna center myself, take deep breaths.
-[Cals] Do your thing. -We will see what comes in.
translation.ko: - 편하게 하세요 - 그런 다음 뭐가 떠오르는지 보죠

translation.en: [Tyler sighs] Okay.
All right.
-We're gonna talk about living people. -Okay.
translation.ko: - 살아 계신 분 얘길 좀 할게요 - 네

translation.en: Um, think, think biological family.
There's gonna be something that comes up
pertaining to someone having a difficulty breathing,
translation.ko: 숨을 제대로 못 쉬는 분이 있어요

translation.en: either finding a spot on an X-ray of our lungs.
translation.ko: 숨을 제대로 못 쉬는 분이 있어요 엑스레이를 찍었는데 폐에서 덩어리가 발견됐다든가

translation.en: There's been either a conversation around it,
but it doesn't feel like it's been taken as seriously as it should--
[Cals] My mother.
-In the long run. -She said she had a spot on her lung.
-But that's… -Yeah.
How did you know that? Like, would it… You felt the spot? Or like…
[Tyler] I see it visually.
Uh, I had a collapsed lung earlier this year.
translation.ko: 올해 초에 저도 폐허탈을 앓긴 했지만

translation.en: It does come through similar in the sense of
seeing an X-ray and seeing a spot.
In early 2020, I had actually had a collapsed lung.
It was resting on my heart.
While I don't think my ability caused that,
I have a lot of physical effects from readings, and they put me through it.
translation.ko: 리딩이 몸에 무리를 주는 건 사실이기 때문에

translation.en: So I have no idea how this will affect my body in the long run.
translation.ko: 장기적으로 어떤 영향을 줄지는 잘 모르겠어요

translation.en: Gonna touch the watch, if that's all right.
-Go for it. -Let's see what comes in.
Okay. Got you. [smacks lips]
I have these two males that are coming through together
that I have to talk about.
Any time people come through together, it means that
translation.ko: 한 명 이상이 함께 떠오르는 건

translation.en: they have some link or bond on the other side.
Like, I wouldn't connect with one. I'd have to connect with both.
translation.ko: 그럴 땐 두 분 모두와 연결해야 하죠

translation.en: -[Cals] They're family. -Yeah.
It's interesting, the way it comes through.
One comes through younger, one older,
translation.ko: 한 명은 젊고 한 명은 나이가 많아요

translation.en: in the way this is coming across, but they're both together.
There is a reference to a contemporary that passed.
To explain this 'cause I see this symbolically,
if I say that, it's someone on our level.
translation.ko: 여기서 동시대라는 건 존재의 층을 말하죠

translation.en: -Yeah, yeah. -We're gonna talk about their passing.
Now, very interesting. They kind of are juxtaposed,
translation.ko: 정말 흥미롭네요 두 분 임종이 병치돼 있어요

translation.en: is I guess the word.
One passing coming with a little bit more baggage than the other.
translation.ko: 한 분이 다른 분보다 짐이 무겁네요

translation.en: -Hell yeah. -[Tyler] So it's kind of weird.
The way I'd describe this is,
baggage almost always indicates, like, a violent end.
translation.ko: 주로 폭력적인 죽음을 맞이했을 때 사용하죠

translation.en: -Something that's like… -[Cals] Yeah.
-[Tyler] Traumatic to watch a scene. -Yeah. That kind of thing.
The other one doesn't strike me with that,
translation.ko: - 다른 분은 그런 게 없어요 - 맞아요

translation.en: which is kind of interesting because he gives this feeling of
an importance in what you're doing in your career.
As you do this, it's almost like his soul finds a greater sense of peace.
translation.ko: 이 일을요 덕분에 자신의 영혼이 더 평화로워졌대요

translation.en: The interesting thing about his passing
was that the medical response there, there's just a delay with this.
-[Tyler] I feel like I just sit there. -Yes.
Why didn't somebody call faster?
-Why didn't we get there? -How do you…
translation.ko: - '왜 거기 안 갔어?' - 맙소사, 그걸 어떻게…

translation.en: I know. There was a conversation around it,
I can tell, people were like, "What? How did this happen?"
That's exactly what it was.
We were waiting about,
I don't know, 20, 30 minutes. The hospital was right down the street.
-We're like, "Where is the ambulance?" -Yeah. Exactly.
-That's crazy. -[Tyler] It's rough.
He doesn't want anyone to hold onto it.
When it comes across, it gives him this feeling of
not wanting them to think they could've done it different--
translation.ko: 다르게 할 수 있었단 생각은 버리란 거죠

translation.en: -That's crazy. -Should've been immediate.
So if you could share like his name, a little bit about him…
That's my older cousin, Ducky,
who just kinda looked out for me a lot.
Big, lovable guy. Will flip a dumpster for you.
translation.ko: 순둥이 거구였어요 대형 쓰레기통도 뒤집을 만큼

translation.en: -You know. He's a big, big guy. Big guy. -[Tyler] Yeah.
Heart of gold, though, man. Doesn't matter the situation.
Whatever it was, he's coming through in the clutch.
translation.ko: 도움이 절실한 사람을 외면하는 법이 없었죠

translation.en: So, basically, me and him worked at a job
that he had, that, uh… We were making, like, drywall and stuff.
I was getting comfortable at the job.
I'm like, "I'm making good money,"
but he was like, "Do the music. Do the music. Don't get comfortable here."
translation.ko: 형이 그랬어요 '음악을 해, 안주하면 안 돼'

translation.en: -And then-- -Yeah.
He basically died of a heart attack at the job and--
translation.ko: 형은 일하다가 심장 마비가 와서 사망했어요

translation.en: Yeah.
[Cals] He worked himself to death.
He's a big part of my influence, and this new fire I got. Know what I mean?
translation.ko: 내게 큰 영향을 줬어요 원동력이 돼 줬죠

translation.en: I love that. That's a gift you carry with you every day.
translation.ko: 좋네요, 그 선물을 매일 가지고 다니시잖아요

translation.en: What a blessing.
-Big blessing. -[Tyler] Amazing.
-That's just-- -[Tyler] I'm so glad.
My mind, man. [chuckles]
So we're gonna keep going. They're switching gears a little bit.
[Tyler] There…
Uh, okay. That's interesting.
This is really weird.
They're showing me shoes for some reason. Shoes.
Who's showing you shoes?
[Tyler] It's coming in on the cousin level for sure.
Why would we be thinking about red shoes?
Uh, he had these… I had this pair of Varsity Red Jordans.
And he used to be like, "Bruh, please let me wear these."
translation.ko: 형이 이러곤 했어요 '어이, 나도 그 신발 좀 신자'

translation.en: He loved those red shoes.
-[Tyler] Weird. -Yeah.
[Tyler] Okay. This guy, I feel like
would've passed away… In all honesty, it comes across, like…
translation.ko: 세상을 떠날 때… 솔직히 발현 방식으로 봐서…

translation.en: -It's some heavy stuff. -Yeah.
[Tyler] This is one of those interesting things where you get a reference to
"Candle in the Wind." That was a weird thing to say. [laughs]
But it's usually a reference that means living every day to the fullest and
kind of passing away too early or too soon.
Yeah, he'd crack a bottle open at 2:30 in the afternoon
translation.ko: 맞아요, 오후 2시 반이면 술을 마시곤 했죠

translation.en: just to live. You know?
He made sure he did everything he was planning to do before he left.
translation.ko: 그래도 계획한 건 다 이루고 죽었어요

translation.en: [Tyler] Some people live to be 90, and don't live at all.
-Yeah. Facts. Facts. -[Tyler] Right? So… yeah.
He's referring to somebody like "Mickey" or "Mikey"?
Or something.
-Who's it coming from? -[Tyler] It's coming from one of the two,
translation.ko: - 누가요? - 저는… 둘 중 한 명인데

translation.en: but I can't understand why. That's why I'm not confident in it.
translation.ko: 이해가 잘 안 돼서 자신은 없지만

translation.en: It's who they're watching over or around. It usually refers to a person.
translation.ko: 그분 주변에서 지켜보나 봐요 대개 사람을 가리키죠

translation.en: We'll keep that in mind in the future.
We're gonna keep going. They're having me talk about
finishing something up or completing something.
It's interesting
There's gonna be something either involving their voice, a recording.
translation.ko: 그분들 목소리나 목소리 녹음 같은 게

translation.en: -Something that gets included. [chuckles] -Yeah. [laughs]
And it's just, like, almost like a nod to them in, in a musical piece.
We used to… I used to come into town all the time.
translation.ko: 예전에 우리가… 제가 항상 시내에 갔어요

translation.en: This is on the contemporary, on our level.
And uh, we used to get that, throw some beats on, and we'd just freestyle.
translation.ko: 거기서 반주 틀어 놓고 프리스타일 랩을 하곤 했죠

translation.en: -And I have the last recording. -[Tyler] Right.
From when I went back out of town, before I got that news that he had passed.
translation.ko: 녹음하고 시내를 떠난 뒤에 형이 사망했단 얘길 들었죠

translation.en: -[Tyler] Yeah. -Uh…
And I don't know how the hell you'd know that I had a recording of him.
translation.ko: 녹음한 게 나한테 있는 걸 어떻게 알았죠?

translation.en: Yeah. It's big. It seems important,
and they show a lot of pride around it.
They feel very like, whoo! Like, I feel happy about this.
translation.ko: 이분들이 신난 걸 보니 저도 행복한데

translation.en: I feel, in this way, his legacy will live on in an interesting way.
-There's a pat on the back around that. -Yeah. That's crazy.
[Tyler] Please know that's important.
They're kind of wanting me to acknowledge… [sighs] their passing.
translation.ko: 이분들이 자신의 죽음을 인지해 달라고 하는데…

translation.en: Just give me one sec.
It'll hit you, if you know what I know then.
translation.ko: 내가 짐작하는 그거라면 그 사건 같은데요

translation.en: Yeah. It's all good. My chest is killing me here.
translation.ko: 네, 괜찮아요 가슴 통증이 너무 심하네요

translation.en: But give me one sec. I also--
-[Cals] Crazy. -It's more of… [blows] Give me one minute.
-[Cals] Yeah. -I've kinda… feeling my own pain, I think.
translation.ko: - 네 - 뭐랄까, 제 몸의 통증 같아요

translation.en: Strange. Okay. Come on
Okay.
Okay. Um…
Around the more violent situation, there's a feeling
I'm getting shot from the side.
Hey, yo.
Yeah. I know that's heavy stuff,
but I'm not gonna get into it.
They're just bringing it up.
-Yeah. -[Tyler] Yeah.
It's all good.
Of leading up to this passing, I feel like someone kind of betrays me.
translation.ko: 임종 전에 누가 이분을 배신한 것 같아요

translation.en: There's some aspect of you they're acknowledging. Betrayal.
Thinking somebody was one way, and they were another way.
But there's an aspect leading up to it that feels like it ties in some way.
translation.ko: 하지만 어떤 식으로든 연결된 것 같은데

translation.en: I feel like I got betrayed.
Without elaborating too much, you're absolutely right.
translation.ko: 자세히 설명 안 해도 알아요 그 말이 맞아요

translation.en: -[Tyler] It makes sense. -What the fuck.
It's all good. Do you know of anyone who would have an "s-h"-sounding name?
So, like, "Sheree"? "Sherri"? I'm getting, phonetically, the "shh" kind of sound.
Shon is… It's Vashon. He just calls himself, uh…
-He tells everybody to call him Shon. Yes. -[Tyler] Gotcha.
translation.ko: 자길 션이라고 부르라고 했죠 - 그렇군요 - 네

translation.en: How's he pertinent? Or is he at all?
Oh, Vashon is my cousin. That's whose watch you're holding.
translation.ko: 배션은 내 사촌이에요 그게 배션의 시계죠

translation.en: That's the person who died from a traumatic death.
[Tyler] That makes sense.
[Cals] His father is my mother's brother. So…
translation.ko: 배션의 아버지가 제 외삼촌이죠 그래서 함께 자랐어요 저랑 동갑이에요

translation.en: We grew up together. All the same age.
-Matching outfits. -[Tyler] Mm-hmm.
♪ Happy birthday to you ♪
♪ Happy birthday to you ♪
[Cals] Rapping together. Performing together. Everything.
translation.ko: 같이 랩도 하고, 공연도 하고 뭐든 같이했어요

translation.en: This is my other half.
We were on the same path up until about 17,
when he got arrested.
He got sentenced to do ten years.
That's when I popped off. That's when everything…
translation.ko: 저는 일로 주목받기 시작했고요 모든 것이…

translation.en: I got all my placements.
I did my first publishing deal, everything in between.
So that when he gets out at 27, I only get to hang with him
translation.ko: 션은 27살에 출소했는데 그 뒤로 얼굴 본 게

translation.en: for three years after that. Died at thirty.
-Wow. -[Cals] So…
Beat. Shot. Stabbed.
Burned.
-Wow. -Just about everything that can happen.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 짓은 다 한 거죠

translation.en: -It's gang shit. -[Tyler] Yeah.
It's meant for it to be a closed casket.
translation.ko: 그럼 장례식 때 관도 못 열어요

translation.en: It's meant for your mom to think about that shit over and over,
and how it happened, and what happened.
But he's very street-smart. So he…
The position that he was found in
is not a situation that he would get in on his own.
He would be able to read the room. He's real intuitive.
-Very. -Really intuitive.
So without going too far into it 'cause it's a lot of
street politics and gang shit and everything. So it's…
There was a person he was hanging around a lot,
whom, uh, he had a real tumultuous harmony.
Weird relationship they had.
That person was the last person that he was around.
translation.ko: 션이 죽기 전 마지막으로 만난 사람이 그 친구예요

translation.en: -Yeah. -[Cals] You know.
I think it's validation today, when he comes through, of your feelings.
translation.ko: 오늘 션은 당신 생각이 옳다는 걸 말해주려 한 것 같아요

translation.en: The fact that you do know
that he wouldn't be in that situation organically.
At all.
[Tyler] So his big message today
is really this understanding of validating that what you think is correct. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 당신 생각이 옳다는 걸 증명하는 거였어요

translation.en: And particularly how that pertains to that person. So…
[Cals] Just you being able to tell me that whatever I'm…
Whatever that little, that hunch is…
-[Tyler] It's very much real. -Yeah.
When you think of him, what's your favorite memory with him?
translation.ko: 그분과 관련해서 가장 좋았던 기억이 있다면요?

translation.en: [Cals] Uh… There was one time we were in South Carolina.
We were walkin' around. He came across a dog.
He always wanted a dog.
-And take him to the hotel. Wash him up. -Yeah.
[Cals] We used all the towels.
And then just dumped them by the clean-up lady's door.
-And they called my grandfather. -[Tyler] Yeah.
-Yeah. -You got busted.
'Cause it wasn't even what we did. It was that somebody had to call
translation.ko: 우리가 한 짓 때문이 아니라 우리가 뭘 하고 있었는지

translation.en: to tell him what we were doing.
-And we were saying earlier, Mickey. -Right.
translation.ko: - 그런데 아까 미키 얘길 했죠? - 맞아요

translation.en: -My uncle Mickey likes this story. -[laughs]
He said it at his funeral.
-That is fucking crazy. -[laughs]
-This is nuts, man. -[Tyler] It's all good.
This is crazy.
You know, my girl is the reason this happened.
translation.ko: 오늘 이 자리는 내 여자 친구가 마련한 거예요

translation.en: She wrote a letter in for me.
So I was kind of skeptical as it was, or just looking for the bullshit.
translation.ko: 난 좀 의심스러워서 사기면 다 밝혀낸다고 했는데

translation.en: But, uh, I… I mean, there's no way you would know that.
translation.ko: 당신이 그걸 미리 알 방법이 없어요

translation.en: I'm an intuitive person.
-And I feel what I feel. -[Tyler] Yeah.
But there's family members that don't even know what you're telling me.
translation.ko: 당신이 한 얘기는 우리 가족도 모르고 있어요

translation.en: -[Tyler] Yeah. -That's nuts.
It's interesting that you said you're intuitive 'cause I feel like
you're more connected than the average person.
translation.ko: 보통 사람보다 연결이 강한 게 느껴져요

translation.en: -Yeah. One hundred percent. -Those hunches, those gut feelings…
Those downloads when you know something,
but you can't explain why. They're very real. This is interesting.
translation.ko: 이유를 설명할 순 없지만 진짜예요, 흥미롭네요

translation.en: -Thank you. -[Tyler] Yeah.
This is gonna change me all my life from here on out.
-I'm not gonna second-guess the intuition. -[Tyler] Good.
translation.ko: - 이젠 직감을 의심 안 할 겁니다 - 좋아요

translation.en: -It's coming from you and your abilities. -Good. Okay.
I'mma take this into my career.
-I'm… I'm leaving with that, man. -Aw, man. I'm so happy.
All right, give me a hug. Give me a hug, bro.
[Cals] What music do you listen to?
Well, being a spiritual person, like, dolphin farts and wind chimes.
translation.ko: 영적인 사람이다 보니 돌고래 방귀나 풍경 소리 같은

translation.en: You know, meditation music, but my mom is actually a huge rap fan.
translation.ko: 명상 음악이죠, 뭐 엄마는 랩을 엄청 좋아해요

translation.en: -Really? -She's a four-foot-eleven Italian woman.
But, uh, she loves Lil Jon, Snoop.
-[Cals] Wow… -Everybody. She likes gangster rap.
-With the finger pistols. -[Tyler] She's too much.
Get her in here.
-Throw her in the booth. [laughs] -Let me go grab her. I'll be right back.
[Cals] This dude's not sitting there sweatin',
translation.ko: 이 친구는 땀 흘리며 앉아 있거나

translation.en: scribblin' on a pad or anything. He's… He's really channeling something.
translation.ko: 종이에 끄적이는 게 아니라 정말 뭔가와 교신해요

translation.en: He's seeing stuff. I'm looking for all of the chinks in the armor,
but I couldn't find any. He's locking in and going somewhere else.
translation.ko: 그런 건 없었어요 정말 다른 차원으로 가더군요

translation.en: This guy's the real deal, man.
-Hey!
-Hey! -Hi.
-How are you? Good to meet you. -[Tyler] Aw…
-So you're the gangster. [laughs] - Oh my God. Oh my God.
I'm just so overwhelmed. This is like going into the space shuttle.
translation.ko: 지금 너무 벅차요 우주 왕복선에 탄 기분이에요

translation.en: -Nobody gets to do that. -Welcome to the spaceship.
translation.ko: - 이런 행운이 어딨어요? - 우주선에 잘 오셨습니다

translation.en: -You wanna jump in the booth? -[Theresa] This is too funny.
translation.ko: - 부스에 가 보시겠어요? - 세상에, 너무 웃겨

translation.en: I don't know what to do. Help me!
All right, it's coming through. You might get a little hiss.
translation.ko: 이걸 쓰세요 지지직 소리가 날 거예요

translation.en: Ma's in the booth, Tyler.
-♪ Driving Miss Crazy ♪ -Yeah.
♪ Around the block ♪
-Oh. -♪ Take it to the top ♪
-♪ Take it to the top ♪ -♪ All way to the top ♪
[Theresa] ♪ That's all I got ♪
-♪ All she got ♪ -I promise, that's all she's got.
God. Thank you so much. Right now--
-The woman that birthed me. -Do you know how happy it makes me?
translation.ko: - 저를 낳아준 분이에요 - 제가 얼마나 기쁜지 아세요?

translation.en: Do you know how happy it makes me?
Wait till we drop the album.
The mixtape.
[Tyler] Now, talking about ancestry…
I wanna talk to you 'cause I'm confused about the birth certificate.
translation.ko: 그 얘기 좀 해요 출생증명서가 좀 헷갈려요

translation.en: -Me too. -[Tyler] So, do you…
Were you issued a birth certificate when you were born?
I was, but I don't believe it's the same birth certificate that I have now.
translation.ko: 그렇기는 한데, 내가 지금 가지고 있는 것과는 달라

translation.en: Interesting.
[Theresa] Up until in my mid-50s,
I thought that Stella and Gwle were my biological parents.
She told me she was my mother,
and that's what my birth certificate said.
So, your middle name was "Wava," but this has you down as "Java."
translation.ko: 엄마 중간 이름은 '웨이바'인데 여긴 '자바'라고 돼 있어요

translation.en: -[Theresa] Right. -As much as you like coffee…
-[Theresa] Yeah. I know. -[Tyler] …this seems an error.
So I know my birth certificate has been doctored.
Jesus, this is like going through a riddle.
-[Theresa] I know. -To get to the bottom of this.
I always wonder who I am, where I came from.
translation.ko: 늘 궁금해요 난 누구고 어디서 왔나?

translation.en: What could've been?
And I'm just so thankful that Tyler has taken an interest.
He wants to know more about his heritage.
It's not just about me. It's about Tyler.
He has a right to know, and I can't take that away from him,
translation.ko: 걘 알 권리가 있죠 그걸 빼앗을 수도 없고

translation.en: nor would I ever want to.
Just finding out that Stella isn't your mother--
translation.ko: 스텔라가 내 엄마가 아닌 걸 알게 됐잖아

translation.en: -[Tyler] Yeah. -Oh my God. It was a relief.
It was like a ton of bricks had been lifted off of me.
translation.ko: 날 짓누르던 큰 짐을 벗은 기분이었어

translation.en: [voice breaks] Because I know I'm not related to her, I'm not like her.
translation.ko: 난 그 여자와 관련도 없고 다르니까

translation.en: -You couldn't be more different. -I know. I know I'm a good person.
translation.ko: - 완전히 다르죠 - 알아, 난 좋은 사람이야

translation.en: [Tyler] Yeah. Aw…
-No, it's okay, Tyler. I'm fine. -Come here and give me a hug.
translation.ko: - 괜찮아, 난 괜찮아 - 이리 와요, 안아 줄게요

translation.en: You're such a good boy.
Oh, well, sometimes, when I behave.
translation.ko: 뭐… 가끔 그렇죠 말을 잘 들을 때는요

translation.en: [Tyler] I feel like my life is defined
by moments of trying to help people find a sense of peace.
My main way is through readings.
For my mom, I want her to get as close as she can to a sense of closure.
translation.ko: 엄마가 이 문제를 최대한 종결짓기를 바랐는데

translation.en: But after two years, my mom and I still don't know the truth.
translation.ko: 2년이 지난 지금도 우린 진실을 알지 못하죠

translation.en: How did she get in the hands of a criminal?
People ask me all the time in readings, "Are there evil people?"
translation.ko: 사람들이 늘 제게 사악한 사람이 있는지 묻는데

translation.en: There's certainly evil acts.
[Theresa] Stella, the woman who I actually thought was my mother,
was a murderer.
